taxExempt.description: Platform-owned indicator of whether or not the billing account is tax-exempt.  If not present it implies that it is not

billingFirstName.description: Platform-owned first name on the billing account.

billingLastName.description: Platfrom-owned last name on the billing account.

billingCCType.description: Platform-owned type of CC on the billing account.

billingCCLast4.description: Platform-owned last 4 digits of the CC on the billing account

billingStreet1.description: Platform-owned street address on the billing account

billingStreet2.description: Platform-owned street address on the billing account

billingCity.description: Platform-owned city on the billing account's address

billingState.description: Platform-owned state on the billing account's address

billingZip.description: Platform-owned zip code on the billing account's address

billingZipPlusFour.description: Platform-owned digits of the zip code after the plus sign on the billing account's address

owner.description: The person ID of the account owner

stepcompleted.description: The last step the account has completed during the signup process

placeID.description: Place ID to associate the initial subscription to
Place ID to associate the new service plan info with.

serviceLevel.description: The new service level for the specified place.

addons.description: Map of addons to booleans indicating if the addon is active for the specified place.

place.description: Instance of the writable place model attributes represented as a map

population.description: The ID of the population that the place will be a member of.  If not provided the place will be part of the general population

serviceLevel.description: The service level the new place will be at.

addons.description: Map of addons to booleans indicating if the addon will be actived for the new place.

deleteOwnerLogin.description: When set to true will also remove the login for the owner of the account, false will leave it.  If not specified, defaults to false

accountId.description: The account id for the deliquent invoice

amountInCents.description: The amount to credit. Must be a negative amount of cents

description.description: The reason for the credit, or empty

placeID.description: Place ID to associate the initial subscription to

serviceLevel.description: The current v1 service level translated into the V2 enumeration

alertState.description: The current state of this alert.

devices.description: The addresses of all the devices that are able to participate in this alarm.

excludedDevices.description: The addresses of the devices that are excluded from participating in this alarm.

activeDevices.description: The addresses of the devices that are participating in this alarm.

offlineDevices.description: The addresses of the devices would be active except they have fallen offline.

triggeredDevices.description: The addresses of the devices which are currently triggered.

triggers.description: The triggers associated with the current alert.

monitored.description: True if this alarm is professionally monitored.

silent.description: When true only notifications will be sent, alert devices / keypads will not sound.

placeId.description: The place this incident occurred at

startTime.description: Platform-owned start time of the incident

prealertEndtime.description: The time that the prealert will complete.

endTime.description: The time the incident ended, won't be set for the currently active incident

alertState.description: The current alert state of the incident.  This may begin in PREALERT for a security alarm grace period, then go to ALERT, transition to CANCELLING when the user requests that it be cancelled, and finally to COMPLETE when it is no longer active.

confirmed.description: True if the incident has been confirmed

monitoringState.description: An enum of the current monitoring state: NONE - If the alerts are not monitored PENDING - If the alert is monitored but we have not contacted the monitoring station yet DISPATCHING - If we have contacted the monitoring station but the authorities have not been contacted yet DISPATCHED - If the authorities have been contacted REFUSED - If the authorities have been contacted but refused the dispatch CANCELLED - If the alarm was cancelled before the authorities were contacted FAILED - If the signal to the monitoring station failed or the monitoring station did not clear the incident within a configured timeout.

platformState.description: An enum of the current platform's view of the incident state.  If hubState is not present, this will be the same as alertState.

hubState.description: An enum of the current hub's view of the incident state.  If there is only a platform alarm provider this will not be present.

additionalAlerts.description: Additional alerts that were part of this incident

tracker.description: A time series list of tracker events.

cancelled.description: If this incident has been cancelled by the user.  It can't be completely cleared until the sensors have stopped reporting smoke/CO and any professional monitoring dispatch has completed.

cancelledBy.description: The address of the person who cancelled the alarm.  This will only be set if: 1 - the incident has cleared 2 - it was "actively" silenced by a user, rather than passively closed by timeout or other event

monitored.description: The monitored flag that should be true if any of the active alarms are monitored or false if none are monitored

limit.description: The maximum number of events to return (defaults to 10)

token.description: The token from a previous query to use for retrieving the next set of results

COAlert.description: Fired when a carbon monoxide alarm is triggered

PanicAlert.description: Fired when a panic alarm is triggered

SecurityAlert.description: Fired when a security alarm is triggered

SmokeAlert.description: Fired when a smoke alarm is triggered

WaterAlert.description: Fired when a water alarm is triggered

HistoryAdded.description: Fired when new history about an incident is added

Completed.description: Fired when an incident has fully completed

alarmState.description: The combined state of the alarm across all alerts.

securityMode.description: The state of the security alarm.

securityArmTime.description: The time at which the security system was or will be armed.  This will be cleared when the security system is disarmed.

lastArmedTime.description: The last time the security alarm was armed.

lastArmedBy.description: The address of the last person to arm the security alarm, this may be empty if it was armed from a scene or a rule.

lastArmedFrom.description: The address of the keypad, rule, scene, or app the security alarm was armed from.

lastDisarmedTime.description: The last time at which the security system was disarmed.

lastDisarmedBy.description: The address of the last person to disarm the security alarm, this may be empty if it was disarmed from a scene or a rule.

lastDisarmedFrom.description: The address of the keypad, rule, scene, or app the security alarm was disarmed from.

activeAlerts.description: A priority ordered list of alerts that are currently active.  Note that the banner should always use the first element from this list, it is ordered.

availableAlerts.description: The set of alarms which are supported by the devices paired at the current place.

monitoredAlerts.description: The set of alarms which are professionally monitored.

currentIncident.description: The currently incident, will be the empty string when there is no current incident.  This may stay populated for a period of time after this incident is over to notify the user that an incident happened next time they login.   Cancelling the incident or disarming from the keypad will clear out the current incident, although it will remain active until dispatch has completed.  When this field is populated the incident screen should be shown.

callTree.description: The list of people who should be notified when the alarm goes into alert mode.  This is marked as a list to maintain ordering, but each entry may only appear once. Note that all addresses must be persons associated with this place.

testModeEnabled.description: Flag used by AlarmIncidentService. When true the service implementation should create a mock incident instead. Defaults to false

fanShutoffSupported.description: Indicates whether fanShutoffOnSmoke and fanShutoffOnCO are supported for the current place.  True if there are any fans, thermostats or space heaters at the current place.

fanShutoffOnSmoke.description: When set to true, all fans, thermostats and space heaters will be turned off when a Smoke alarm is triggered.  Defaults to false.

fanShutoffOnCO.description: When set to true, all fans, thermostats and space heaters will be turned off when a CO alarm is triggered.  Defaults to true

recordingSupported.description: Whether or not the alarm subsystem supports recording on alarm.  This requires the user to have cameras and a premium / promonitoring service level to support recording.

recordOnSecurity.description: When set to true all cameras will record.  This flag may be true even if recordingSupported is false.  Default to be true.

recordingDurationSec.description: The number of seconds to record for when a security alarm is triggered.  Default to be 60 seconds.

alarmProvider.description: The provider of the alarming implementation. Defaults to PLATFORM.

state.description: Reflects the current state of the alert where quiet means that whatever alarm the device is now silent and alerting implies the device is currently alarming (blinking lights, making some noise).

maxAlertSecs.description: Maximum number of seconds that the alert device will stay in alerting state before it will be reset to quiet automatically by its driver. 0 = No Limit.

lastAlertTime.description: The last time this device went to alert state.

updaterate.description: The rate in seconds of how often the water heater polls the platform.

units.description: The display unit of the temperation.

controlmode.description: This is the mode setting of the device, not whether or not it is actually heating the water at the moment.

leakdetect.description: Enable or disable leak detection. Or report that no sensor is present and force to disabled.

gridenabled.description: This device was originally destined for utilities, so if the grid is controlling your device, it means you are responding to commands over Wifi.

dryfire.description: Detects that a dry-fire condition was present

elementfail.description: Status of upper and lower elements

tanksensorfail.description: Status of uppwer and lower temperature sensors.

errors.description: Contains a map of device error codes to verbose, user-friendly definitions.

modelnumber.description: Model number as recorded on the heater's label

serialnumber.description: Serial number as recorded on the heater's label

pairedDevices.description: Map from bridge-owned device identifier to the protocol address of paired children devices

unpairedDevices.description: Set of bridge-owned device identifiers that have been seen but not paired.

pairingState.description: The current pairing state of the bridge device.  PAIRING indicates that any new devices seen will be paired, UNPAIRING that devices are being removed and IDLE means neither

numDevicesSupported.description: Total number of devices this bridge can support.

device.decription: The name of the bridge device.

timeout.description: Amount of time that the bridge device will stay in pairing mode in milliseconds.

device.decription: The name of the bridge device.

bridgeSpecificId.description: The id assigned to this child device by its parent bridge device.

state.description: Reflects the current state of the button where pressed implies the user has pressed the button and released the opposite. Also used to set the state of the button.

statechanged.description: UTC date time of last state change

privacy.description: When true, camera's privacy function is enabled

resolutionssupported.description: List of resolutions supported by the camera e.g. 160x120, 320x240, 640x480, 1280x960

resolution.description: Current resolution of the camera. Must appear in resolutionssupported list.

bitratetype.description: Constant bit rate or variable bit rate

bitratessupported.description: List of bitrates supported by the camera e.g. 32K, 64K, 96K, 128K, 256K, 384K, 512K, 768K, 1024K, 1280K, 2048K

bitrate.description: Only valid when bitrate type is cbr. Must appear in bitratessupported list.

qualitiessupported.description: List of quality levels supported by the camera e.g Very Low, Low, Normal, High, Very High

quality.description: Current quality of the camera. Must appear in qualitiessupported list.

framerate.description: Current framerate of the camera. Must be minframerate <= framerate <= maxframerate

flip.description: When true, camera's image is flipped vertically

mirror.description: When true, camera's image is mirrored horizontally

irLedSupportedModes.description: What camera IR LED modes are supported?

irLedMode.description: Reflects the mode of IR LED on the camera.

irLedLuminance.description: Reflects the current IR LED luminance, on a scale of 1 to 5.

device.decription: The name of the camera device.

maxDuration.description: The maximum time in seconds to stream

currentPan.description: Curent camera pan position, in degrees

currentTilt.description: Curent camera tilt position, in degrees

maximumPan.description: Maximum camera pan position, in degrees

minimumPan.description: Minimum camera pan position, in degrees

maximumTilt.description: Maximum camera tilt position, in degrees

minimumTilt.description: Minimum camera tilt position, in degrees

device.decription: The name of the cameraptz device.
The name of the cameraptz device.
The name of the cameraptz device.

cameras.description: The addresses of cameras defined at this place

offlineCameras.description: The addresses of offline cameras defined at this place

warnings.description: A set of warnings about devices.  The key is the address of the device with a warning and the value is an I18N code with the description of the problem.

recordingEnabled.description: Whether or not recording is enabled based on the service level

maxSimultaneousStreams.description: An estimate of how many simultaneous streams can be supported.  NOTE: While this is currently r/w for testing purposes, it will likely be made read-only in the future and should not be directly exposed as a writable attribute to the end-user.

camera.description: The address of the associated camera.

state.description: An *estimate* of the current state of the camera.  This should be used for displaying metadata not as a guarantee that prevents new recordings / streams from being attempted.

lastRecording.description: Address of the last recording completed by the camera. This will be the empty string in the following cases:  - Camera has never completed a recording  - The most recent recording has been deleted by the user

lastRecordingTime.description: Start time of the last recording that has completed for this camera. Note it will not be updated until the current recording completes.  Also it may contain a time for a non-existent recording if the user has deleted the most recent recording.

activeRecording.description: The address of the video that the camera is currently streaming / recording.

co.description: Reflects the state of the carbon monoxide presence. When 'DETECTED' the sensor has detected CO, when 'SAFE' no CO has been detected.

eol.description: Reflects the state of the carbon monoxide sensor itself. When 'OK' the sensor is operational, when 'EOL' the sensor has reached its 'end-of-life' and should be replaced.

cochanged.description: UTC date time of last co change

coppm.description: Measured value of the Carbon Monoxide in the room in parts per million

triggeredDevices.description: The addresses of all the currently triggered care-capable devices in this place.

inactiveDevices.description: The addresses of all the currently inactive care-capable devices in this place.

careDevices.description: This addresses of all the current care devices in this place.

careCapableDevices.description: The addresses of all the current care-capable devices in this place.

behaviors.description: The list of ids of behaviors that are currently defined on the subsystem.  Use ListBehaviors to get details.

activeBehaviors.description: The list of ids of behaviors that are currently active

alarmMode.description: Whether the care alarm is currently turned on or in visit mode.  During visit mode behaviors will not trigger the care alarm, but the care pendant may still generate a panic.

alarmState.description: Whether the alarm is currently going of or not.

lastAlertTime.description: The last time the alarm was fired.

lastAlertCause.description: The reason the alarm was fired.

lastAlertTriggers.description: A map of behavior id to timestamp of when a behavior was triggered during an alert.  This map will not be populated until the alarm enters the alert state. Note this will only include the first time a behavior was triggered during an alert.  For more detailed information see the history log.

lastAcknowledgement.description: The current state of acknowledgement:     PENDING - Iris is attempting to notify the user that an alarm has been triggered     ACKNOWLEDGED - One of the persons from the call tree has acknowledged the alarm     FAILED - No one acknowledged the alarm but no one was available to acknowledged it.

lastAcknowledgementTime.description: The last time at which acknowledgement changed to ACKNOWLEDGED or FAILED.  This will be empty when lastAcknowledgement is PENDING.

lastAcknowledgedBy.description: The actor that acknowledge the alarm when lastAcknowledgement is ACKNOWLEDGED.  Otherwise this field will be empty.

lastClearTime.description: The last time the alarm was disarmed.  This is the time that Disarm was requested, not the time at which CLEARING completed.

lastClearedBy.description: The actor that disarmed the alarm, if available.  If it can't be determined this will be empty.

callTreeEnabled.description: Whether the call tree should be used or just the account owner should be notified in an alarm scenario.  This will currently be false when the place is on BASIC and true when the place is on PREMIUM.

callTree.description: The call tree of users to notify when an alarm is triggered.  This list includes all the persons associated with the current place, whether or not they are alerted is determined by the boolean flag.  Order is determined by the order of the list.

silent.description: When true only notifications will be sent, alert devices will not be triggered.

careDevicesPopulated.description: Flag indicating that careDevices has been initialized from careCapableDevices.  This is to initialize the field a single time. Data FIX

start.description: The start time of the interval

end.description: The end time of the interval

bucket.description: The number of seconds in each bucket

devices.description: The devices to show activity for

limit.description: The maximum number of events to return (defaults to 10)

token.description: The token from a previous query to use for retrieving the next set of results. Note an exact time may be jumped to by specifying token as a timestamp in epoch milliseconds.

devices.description: The devices to show activity for. If none are specified the value of careDevices will be used.

id.description: Id of the behavior to remove.

behaviorName.description: Behavior Name that triggered the alert.

triggeredDevices.description: List of device addresses that triggered the Care Alert

BehaviorAlert.description: Alerts the system that a behaviors has triggered an alert.

BehaviorAlertCleared.description: The care alert has been cleared.

BehaviorAlertAcknowledged.description: The care alert has been ackknowledged.

behaviorId.description: The behavior id of the modified behavior.

behaviorName.description: The behavior name of the modified behavior

BehaviorAction.description: Alerts the system that a behaviors has triggered an alert.

status.description: READY:  Will work: Modem is plugged in, healthy, connected, and add on subscription exists for place ACTIVE:  Is working: Hub is actively connected to hub bridge via cellular NOTREADY:  Will not work (user recoverable) : check notReadyState to see if they need a modem or a subscription ERRORED:  Will not work (requires contact center) : check erroredState for more information

errorState.description: NONE:  No error NOSIM:  Modem is plugged in but does not have a SIM NOTPROVISIONED:  Modem is plugged in but SIM is/was not properly provisioned DISABLED: BANNED: OTHER:  Modem is pluggin in and has a provisioned SIM but for some reason it cannot connect (hub4g:connectionStatus will have a vendor specific code as to why)

notReadyState.description: NEEDSSUB:  Modem is plugged in, healthy, and connected, but no add on subscription for place exists NEEDSMODEM:  Add on subscription for place exists, but no modem plugged in BOTH:  Needs both modem and subscription

CellAccessBanned.description: Event emitted from the subsystem to the hub-bridges to boot the hub if it is currently connected by cell backup

CellAccessUnbanned.description: Event emitted from the subsystem to the hub-bridges to boot the hub if it is currently connected by cell backup

device.decription: The name of the centralitesmartplug device.
The name of the centralitesmartplug device.
The name of the centralitesmartplug device.
The name of the centralitesmartplug device.
The name of the centralitesmartplug device.

controlDevices.description: The addresses of all the climate control devices in the climate subsystem, this includes thermostats, fans, vents and spaceheaters.

temperatureDevices.description: The addresses of all the devices in the place that have the temperature capability.

humidityDevices.description: The addresses of all the devices in the place that have the humidity capability.

thermostats.description: DEPRECATED: This attribute is deprecated and will be removed in future iterations! The addresses of all the devices in the place that have the thermostat capability.

thermostatSchedules.description: The current status of the schedule for each thermostat

closedVents.description: The addresses of all vents that are currently closed.

activeFans.description: The addresses of all fans that are currently turned on.

primaryTemperatureDevice.description: The temperature sensor that should be used when displaying the temperature for the whole place.  This may be null if no devices support temperature.

primaryHumidityDevice.description: The humidity sensor that should be used when displaying the humidity for the whole place.  This may be null if no devices support humidity.

primaryThermostat.description: The primary thermostat for the house, this may be null if there are no thermostat devices.

temperature.description: The current temperature for the place, this may be null if there are no temperature devices.  This is currently calculated from primaryTemperatureDevice.

humidity.description: The current humidity for the place, this may be null if there are no humidity devices.  This is currently calculated from primaryHumidityDevice.

activeHeaters.description: The addresses of all devices that implement spaceheater and have heatstate value of ON

thermostat.description: The address of the thermostat to enable the schedule for
The address of the thermostat to disable the schedule for

hue.description: Reflects the current hue or for lack of a better word color. May also be used to set the hue. Range is 0-360 angular degrees.

saturation.description: The saturation or intensity of the hue. Lower values result in less intensity (more gray) and higher values result in a more intense hue (less gray). May also be used to set the saturation.

colortemp.description: Current color temperature in degrees Kelvin.

contact.description: Reflects the state of the contact sensor (opened or closed).

contactchanged.description: UTC date time of last contact change

usehint.description: How the device should be treated for display to the user.  UNKNOWN indicates this value hasn't been set and the user should be queried for how it was installed.  Some devices, such as door hinges, may populate this with an initial value of DOOR or WINDOW, but most drivers will initialize it to UNKNOWN

mode.description: Indicates whether sensor believes it is day or night

modechanged.description: UTC date time of last mode change

drivername.description: The name of the driver handling the device.

driverversion.description: The current verison of the driver handling the device.

drivercommit.description: The commit id from the commit that this file was last changed in.

driverhash.description: A hash of the contents of the file.

protocol.description: Protocol supported by the device; should initially be one of (zwave, zigbee, alljoyn, ipcd)

subprotocol.description: Sub-protocol supported by the device. For zigbee devices, this may be ha1.1, ha1.2, etc.

protocolid.description: Protocol specific identifier for this device. This should be globally unique. For zigbee devices this will be the mac address. For zwave devices, this should be homeid.deviceid.

errors.description: A map where the keys are the errorCode and the values are a more descriptive error message.  These errors should be used for devices that have an error status that may be cleared or may simply indicate the device has passed its usable lifetime.  This is not intended for maintenance errors such as low battery or air filter change.

added.description: Time at which this device was most recently added (date of driver instantiation)

firmwareVersion.description: The firmware version of the device, primarily for devices that do not support OTA. For ZigBee devices it contains the version from the basic cluster, the OTA cluster version goes in devota.

hubLocal.description: True if the device is operating in a hub local manner.

degraded.description: True if the device is operating in a degraded manner for any reason.

degradedCode.description: The code string indicating the reason that a device is operating in a degraded manner.

device.decription: The name of the devadv device.

driverName.description: Optional driver name to upgrade this device to.  If specified driverVersion must also be provided.

driverVersion.description: Optional driver version to upgrade this device to.  If specified driverName must also be provided.

device.decription: The name of the devadv device.

RemovedDevice.description: Sent when a device has been removed for any reason. This may be very specific to the given protocol and require client interpretation.

account.description: Driver-owned account associated with the device

place.description: Driver-owned place where the device is currently located

devtypehint.description: Device Details screen that should be used to view this device

name.description: Human readable name for the device

productId.description: ID of the product catalog that describes this device

limit.description: The maximum number of events to return (defaults to 10)

token.description: The token from a previous query to use for retrieving the next set of results

timeout.description: The number of milliseconds that device removal is expected for.

DeviceConnected.description: Sent when a device comes online. This may be very specific to the given protocol and require client interpretation.

DeviceDisconnected.description: Sent when a device goes offline. This may be very specific to the given protocol and require client interpretation.  Not all drivers will be able to detect this event.

DeviceRemoved.description: Sent when a device is removed.

state.description: Reflects the state of the connection to this device. If the device has intermediate connectivity states at the protocol level, it must be marked as offline until it can be fully controlled by the platform

status.description: Reflects the status of the connection to this device.

lastchange.description: Time of the last change in connect.state

signal.description: A projection from a protocol transport specific measurement of signal strength. For zigbee or wifi this may be the RSSI normalized to percentage.

device.decription: The name of the devconn device.

currentVersion.description: Version of the currently installed firmware.

status.description: Status of the current firmware update process.

lastAttempt.description: UTC date time of last retry attempt.

progressPercent.description: Progress of the current firmware download.

lastFailReason.description: Reason for failure of the OTA (offline, timeout, refused, etc.).

device.decription: The name of the devota device.

priority.description: The priority of the firmware update. Updates at NORMAL priority may be refused in some senarios.

device.decription: The name of the devota device.

dlProgress.description: The percentage of the firmware that has been downloaded.

otaProgress.description: The percentage of the firmware that has been delivered to the device.

reason.description: A message indicating the failure reason

fileVersion.description: Name of the file version used for OTA

FirmwareUpdateProgress.description: Sent when a device has been removed for any reason. This may be very specific to the given protocol and require client interpretation.

source.description: Indicates that this device is currently line-powered

linecapable.description: When true, indicates that it is possible to line-power this device from the mains.

backupbatterycapable.description: When true, indicates the device can support a back-up battery.

battery.description: Level of primary battery. 0 = battery not present.

backupbattery.description: Level of primary battery. 0 = battery not present.

sourcechanged.description: UTC date time of last source change

BackupBattery.description: Fired when a line powered device loses power and is on backup battery.

LinePowerRestored.description: Fired when a device currently on backup battery has line power restored.

BatteryLow.description: Fired when a battery (backup or otherwise) is under 40%.

device.decription: The name of the devmock device.

attrs.description: Attributes to set on the device

device.decription: The name of the devmock device.
The name of the devmock device.

brightness.description: Reflects the current level of brightness, as a percentage. If ramping is not desired, this parameter can be set to immediately achieve the desired brightness level.

rampingtarget.description: Reflects the target brightness, as a percentage, that the dimmer is ramping towards. This should be set to current brightness if ramping is complete. This parameter is read-only and should be controlled via the RampBrightness method if ramping is desired.

rampingtime.description: Number of seconds remaining at current ramping rate before brightness is equal to rampingtarget. When ramping is complete, this value should be set to 0. This parameter is read-only and should be controlled via the RampBrightness method if ramping is desired.

device.decription: The name of the dim device.

brightness.description: Brightness percentage within the range of 0..100

seconds.description: Number of seconds to reach desired brightness; must be a positive integer

device.decription: The name of the dim device.

amount.description: The amount to increase the brightness as a percentage from 0 to 100

device.decription: The name of the dim device.

amount.description: The amount to decrease the brightness as a percentage from 0 to 100

lockstate.description: Reflects the state of the lock mechanism.

type.description: Reflects the type of door lock.

slots.description: Reflects the mapping between slots and people

numPinsSupported.description: The number of pins that this device supports

supportsInvalidPin.description: True if this driver will fire an event when an invalid pin is used

supportsBuzzIn.description: Indicates whether or not the driver supports the BuzzIn method.

lockstatechanged.description: UTC date time of last lockstate change

device.decription: The name of the doorlock device.

personId.description: The ID of the person to add to the lock

device.decription: The name of the doorlock device.

personId.description: The ID of the person to remove from the lock

The name of the doorlock device.

InvalidPin.description: If the driver supports it this will be emitted when an invalid pin is entered

PinUsed.description: Fired when a pin is used to lock or unlock the lock

PinAddedAtLock.description: Fired when a pin is added manually at the lock.

PinRemovedAtLock.description: Fired when a pin is removed manually at the lock.

PinChangedAtLock.description: Fired when a pin is changed manually at the lock.

PersonAuthorized.description: Emitted when the driver receives a report that a person has been provisioned on the device

PersonDeauthorized.description: Emitted when the driver receives a report that a person has been deprovisioned from the device

PinOperationFailed.description: Emitted when the driver receives report that a person's PIN operation failed on the device

ClearAllPinsFailed.description: Emitted when the drivers receives a failure clearing the pins or fails to recieve confirmation

lockDevices.description: The addresses of door locks defined at this place

motorizedDoorDevices.description: The addresses of motorized doors defined at this place

contactSensorDevices.description: The addresses of contact sensors defined at this place

petDoorDevices.description: The addresses of pet doors defined at this place

warnings.description: A set of warnings about devices which have potential issues that could cause an alarm to be missed.  The key is the address of the device with a warning and the value is an I18N code with the description of the problem.

unlockedLocks.description: The addresses of door locks that are currently unlocked

offlineLocks.description: The addresses of door locks that are currently offline

jammedLocks.description: The addresses of door locks that are currently jammed

openMotorizedDoors.description: The addresses of motorized doors that are currently open

offlineMotorizedDoors.description: The addresses of motorized doors that are currently offline

obstructedMotorizedDoors.description: The addresses of motorized doors that are currently obstructed

openContactSensors.description: The addressees of currently open contact sensors

offlineContactSensors.description: The addresses of currently offline contact sensors

unlockedPetDoors.description: The addresses of currently locked pet doors

autoPetDoors.description: The addresses of pet doors in auto mode

offlinePetDoors.description: The addresses of offline pet doors

allPeople.description: The set of all people at the place that could be assigned to a lock (those with access and a pin)

authorizationByLock.description: A between a door lock and the people that currently have access to that lock

If the hub is already publishing snapshots, it should increment some counter for the number of requests it has received but not start new uploads so when StopCameraPreviews is issued it will know when it is safe to stop uploading.

budget.description: Default: 100. Setting this number from 10-90 (most devices only support 10% increments) reduces the water usage to that percentage. Setting this number from 110-200) increases water usage for dryer moments. Note: current Orbit devices support 'stacking' meaning if the increased schedule results in a subsequent start time to be delayed, this start time becomes 'stacked' and handled as soon as possible. If the UI supports showing the user what zone is running, supporting budget>100 means the UI will need to compute this stacking. Alternative is to not allow this number to be over 100 (as Iris1 does).

alarmState.description: Current alarm state of the keypad.          Generally this should only be controlled via the specific methods (BeginArming, Armed, Disarmed, Soaking, Alerting).          However it may be set manually in case the keypad is no longer in sync with the security system.  In this case the          keypad should avoid making transition noises (such as the armed or disarmed beeps).  However if the state is          ARMING, SOAKING, or ALERTING and the associated sounds are enabled it should beep accordingly.

alarmMode.description: The current mode of the alarm.          Generally this should only be controlled via the specific methods (BeginArming, Armed, Disarmed, Soaking, Alerting).          However it may be set manually in case the keypad is no longer in sync with the security system.

alarmSounder.description: DEPRECATED           When set to ON enabledSounds should be set to [BUTTONS,DISARMED,ARMED,ARMING,SOAKING,ALERTING].          When set to OFF enabledSounds should be set to [].          If enabledSounds is set to a value other than [] this should be changed to ON.          If both alarmSounder and enabledSounds are set in the same request an error should be thrown.

enabledSounds.description: This contains the set of times when the keypad should play tones, the common combinations are:          Keypad Sounds On  / Normal Alarm  - [BUTTONS,DISARMED,ARMED,ARMING,SOAKING,ALERTING]          Keypad Sounds Off / Normal Alarm  - [ALERTING]          Keypad Sounds On  / Silent Alarm  - [BUTTONS,DISARMED,ARMED,ARMING]          Keypad Sounds Off / Silent Alarm  - []                    Each sound should be enabled if it is present in the set or disabled if it is not present:          BUTTONS - Button presses should beep          DISARMED - Play a tone when the keypad disarms          ARMING - Play an exit delay tone          ARMED - Play a tone when the keypad is armed          SOAKING - Play an entrance delay tone          ALERTING - Play an alert tone

alarm.description: Indicates the current state of the alarm:         - READY - The alarm is active and watching for safety alerts         - WARN - The alarm is active, but one or more of the safety sensors has low battery or connectivity issues that could potentially cause an alarm to be missed         - SOAKING - One or more safety devices have triggered, but not a sufficient amount of time or devices to set off the whole system.         - ALERT - A safety device has triggered an alarm         - CLEARING - A request has been made to CLEAR the alarm, but there are still devices triggering an alarm.

Each value means:     NONE - There are no devices of the given type     SAFE - All devices of that type are on and haven't detected a safety alarm     OFFLINE - At least one device of the given type is offline, but none have detected a safety alarm     DETECTED - At least one device of the given type has detected a safety alarm

NOT_SUPPORTED:  No scheduling is possible either via Iris or the physical device DEVICE_ONLY:  Scheduling is not possible via Iris, but can be configured on the physical device DRIVER_READ_ONLY:  Iris may read scheduling information via a driver specific implementation but cannot write schedule information DRIVER_WRITE_ONLY:  Iris may write scheduling information via a driver specific implementation but cnnot read schedule information SUPPORTED_DRIVER:  Iris may completely control scheduling of the device via a driver specific implementation (i.e. schedule is likely read and pushed to the device) SUPPORTED_CLOUD:  Iris may completely control scheduling of the device via an internal mechanism (i.e. cloud or hub based)

scheduleEnabled.description: Whether or not a schedule is currently enabled for this device

device.decription: The name of the schedulable device.
The name of the schedulable device.

group.description: The scheduling group.  Only one Schedule in a scheduling group may be enabled at a time.

enabled.description: Whether or not this scheduled is currently enabled to run.  When disabled no scheduled commands will be sent.

nextFireTime.description: The next time the schedule will fire, this may be null if the schedule is disabled or there are no scheduled times.

nextFireCommand.description: The command that will be sent when it fires next.  This is a key into the commands attribute.

lastFireTime.description: The last time the schedule executed a command.

lastFireCommand.description: The id of the last command that was executed.  This may not exist in the commands attribute if the schedule has been modified since it last fired.

lastFireMessageType.description: The type of message that was sent on last execution.

lastFireAttributes.description: The attributes that were sent on last execution.

commandId.description: The id of the command to delete.

placeId.description: The ID of the place that this object is associated with.

target.description: The target that scheduled messages will be sent to.

nextFireTime.description: The next time a scheduled command will fire.  This may be null if all schedules are disabled.

nextFireSchedule.description: ID of the schedule that will fire next.

lastFireTime.description: The last time the schedule executed a command.

lastFireSchedule.description: ID of the schedule that fired previously.

commands.description: The commands that this schedule may send.  This is a derived, read-only view.  The specific format of the ScheduledCommand depends on the type of schedule this is.  Currently only WeeklySchedule and TimeOfDayCommand are supported.

commandId.description: The id of the command to fire

id.description: The instance id of the schedule to create.

group.description: Default: id. The group to associate this schedule with, when not specified the id will be used.

devices.description: The addresses of all the security devices that participate in this mode.

entranceDelaySec.description:
The amount of time an alarm device must be triggering for before the alarm is fired.
Default: 30

exitDelaySec.description:
The amount of time before the alarm is fully armed.
Default: 30

alarmSensitivityDeviceCount.description:
The number of alarm devices which must trigger before the alarm is fired.
Default: 1

silent.description: When true only notifications will be sent, alert devices will not be triggered.

soundsEnabled.description:
Hub and keypad make sounds when arming.
Default: true

motionSensorCount.description: The number of the number of motion sensors associated with this mode

securityDevices.description: The addresses of all the security devices in the safety alarm subsystem.  This includes sensor devices (contact and motion), input devices (keypads), and output devices (sirens). Whether or not these devices actually participate in any alarm states depend on the alarm mode.

triggeredDevices.description: Devices which are ready to be armed, this set is empty the the alarmState is not DISARMED.  This will only include sensors.

readyDevices.description: Devices which are ready to be armed, this set is empty the the alarmState is not DISARMED.  This will only include sensors.

armedDevices.description: Devices which may result in triggering an alarm.  This set is empty when the alarmState is DISARMED. Note that armedDevices / bypassedDevices / offlineDevices are disjoint, a value will only appear in one of these sets at a time.  Additionally when the alarm is not​ DISARMED the union of these sets should equals devices:{alarmMode}.

bypassedDevices.description: Devices which are online and would normally be armed in the current mode but have been explicitly bypassed via ArmBypassed.  This set is empty when alarmState is DISARMED. Note that armedDevices / bypassedDevices / offlineDevices are disjoint, a value will only appear in one of these sets at a time.  Additionally when the alarm is not DISARMED the union of these sets should equals devices:{alarmMode}.

offlineDevices.description: Devices which would normally be armed in the current mode but have fallen offline.  This state takes precedent over bypassedDevices. Note that armedDevices / bypassedDevices / offlineDevices are disjoint, a value will only appear in one of these sets at a time.  Additionally when the alarm is not DISARMED the union of these sets should equals devices:{alarmMode}.

alarmState.description: Indicates the current state of the alarm:     DISARMED - The alarm is currently DISARMED.  Note that any devices in the triggered or warning state may prevent the alarm from going to fully armed.     ARMING - The alarm is in the process of arming, delaying giving users a chance to leave the house.     ARMED - Indicate the alarm is armed and any security device may trigger an alarm.  See armedDevices to determine which devices might trigger the alarm.     ALERT - The alarm is 'going off'.  Any sirens are triggered, the call tree is activated, etc.     CLEARING - The alarm has been acknowledged and the system is waiting for all devices to no longer be triggered at which point it will return to DISARMED     SOAKING - An armed secuirty device has triggered the alarm and the system is waiting for the alarm to be disarmed.

alarmMode.description: If the alarmState is 'DISARMED' this will be OFF.  Otherwise it will be id of the alarmMode which is currently active.

lastAlertTime.description: The last time the alarm was fired.

lastAlertCause.description: The reason the alarm was fired.

currentAlertTriggers.description: A map of address to timestamp of when a device was triggered during an alert.  This map will not be populated until the alarm enters the alert state. Note this will only include the first time a device was triggered during an alert.  For more detailed information see the history log.

currentAlertCause.description: The reason the current alert was raised

lastAlertTriggers.description: A map of address to timestamp of when a device was triggered during an alert.  This map will not be populated until the alarm enters the soak state. Note this will only include the first time a device was triggered during an alert.  For more detailed information see the history log.

lastAcknowledgement.description: The current state of acknowledgement:     PENDING - Iris is attempting to notify the user that an alarm has been triggered     ACKNOWLEDGED - One of the persons from the call tree has acknowledged the alarm     FAILED - No one acknowledged the alarm but no one was available to acknowledged it.

lastAcknowledgementTime.description: The last time the alarm was acknowledged.

lastAcknowledgedBy.description: The actor that acknowledge the alarm when lastAcknowledgement is ACKNOWLEDGED.  Otherwise this field will be empty.

lastArmedTime.description: The last time the alarm was armed.

lastArmedBy.description: The actor that armed the alarm, if available.  If it can't be determined this will be empty.

lastDisarmedTime.description: The last time the alarm was disarmed.

lastDisarmedBy.description: The actor that disarmed the alarm, if available.  If it can't be determined this will be empty.

callTreeEnabled.description: Set to true if the account is PREMIUM, indicating the callTree will be used for alerts. Set to false if the account is BASIC, indicating that only the account owner will be notified.

callTree.description: The list of people who should be notified when the alarm goes into alert mode.  This is marked as a list to maintain ordering, but each entry may only appear once. Note that all addresses must be persons associated with this place.

keypadArmBypassedTimeOutSec.description: The number of seconds the subsystem will allow for a second keypad ON push to armbypassed the system.

blacklistedSecurityDevices.description: The addresses of all the devices that are blacklisted, and therefore not considered as security devices.

bypassedDevices.description: Devices which are online and would normally be armed in the current mode but have been explicitly bypassed via ArmBypassed.

participatingDevices.description: Devices which are actively being be used to trigger an alarm.

by.description: The address of the client / device that was used to arm the alarm. Note that while the actor header will always contain a PERSON address, this should contain the address of the keypad or client that was used to arm the alarm.

Armed.description: Fired when the alarmState from ARMING to ARMED.  This event is not re-sent when the system goes from SOAKING to ARMED.

triggers.description: True if the alarm was force armed.

by.description: The address of the thing that tripped the alarm.

Alert.description: Fired when alarmState switches from ARMED to ALERTING.

by.description: The address of the client / device that was used to disarm the alarm. Note that while the actor header will always contain a PERSON address, this should contain the address of the keypad or client that was used to disarm the alarm.

Disarmed.description: Fired when alarmState switches to DISARMED.

level.description: The percentage that the shades are open (raised/lowered). May also be used to set how closed (lowered) or open (raised) the shade is where 100% is fully open and 0% is fully closed. For devices that only support being set fully Open (Raised) or Closed (Lowered), use 0% for Closed (Lowered) and 100% for Open (Raised).

shadestate.description: Reflects the current state of the shade.  Obstruction implying that something is preventing the opening or closing of the shade.

levelchanged.description: UTC time of last level change.

device.decription: The name of the shade device.
The name of the shade device.

smokechanged.description: UTC date time of last smoke change

watercontent.description: Reflects the ratio of volume of water per volume of soil (0.0 = No Moisture, 0.5 = Completely Saturated).

soiltype.description: Reflects the type of soil in which the water content is being measured. Defaults to NORMAL.

watercontentupdated.description: UTC date time of when Water Content value was reported by sensor.

mode.description: The user has to set the type of device (Blinds or Shade) they have to generate the proper UI. Defaults to SHADE.

reversed.description: The user may need to reverse the shade motor direction if wiring is reversed. Defaults to NORMAL.

type.description: The user has to set the type of device (Blinds or Shade) they have to generate the proper UI. Defaults to SHADE.

reversed.description: The user may need to reverse the shade motor direction if wiring is reversed. Defaults to NORMAL.

channel.description: The channel of the Blinds or Shade on the Bridge.

currentstate.description: The current state (position) of the Blinds or Shade reported by the bridge.

statechanged.description: UTC time of last state (OPEN/CLOSED/FAVORITE) change.

setpoint.description: The desired temperature when the unit is running, maps to heatsetpoint in  thermostat. May also be used to set the target temperature.

minsetpoint.description: The minimum temperature that can be placed in setpoint.

maxsetpoint.description: The maximum temperature that can be placed in setpoint.

heatstate.description: The current mode of the device, maps to OFF, HEAT in thermostat:mode.

name.description: A display name for the subsystem, generally not shown to end-users

version.description: The published version of the subsystem

hash.description: A hash of the subsystem may be used to ensure the exact version that is being run

account.description: The account associated with the this subsystem.

place.description: The place the subsystem is associated with, there may be only one instance of each subsystem per place.

available.description: Indicates whether the subsystem is available on the current place or not. When this is false it generally means there need to be more devices added to the place.

state.description: Indicates the current state of a subsystem.  A SUSPENDED subsystem will not collect any new data or enable associated rules, but may still allow previously collected data to be viewed.

coolsetpoint.description: The desired low temperature when the HVAC unit is in cooling or auto mode. May also be used to set the target temperature.

heatsetpoint.description: The desired high temperature when the HVAC unit is in heating or auto mode. May also be used to set the target temperature.

minsetpoint.description: The minimum setpoint for the thermostat, inclusive.  The heatsetpoint can't be set below this and the coolsetpoint can't be set below minsetpoint + setpointseparation.

maxsetpoint.description: The maximum setpoint for the thermostat, inclusive.  The coolsetpoint can't be set above this and the heatsetpoint can't be set above maxsetpoint - setpointseparation.

setpointseparation.description: The heatsetpoint and coolsetpoint should be kept apart by at least this many degrees.  If only heatsetpoint or coolsetpoint are changed then the driver must automatically adjust the other setpoint if needed.  If both are specified and within setpointseparation of each other the driver may adjust either setpoint as needed to maintain the proper amount of separation.

hvacmode.description: The current mode of the HVAC system.

supportsAuto.description: Whether or not the thermostat supports AUTO mode.  If not present, assume true

emergencyheat.description: Useful only for 2 stage heat pumps that require a secondary (usually electric) heater when the external temperature is below a certain threshold.

active.description: Indicator of whether the HVAC system is actively running or not.  Interpreted as fan is blowing, not necessarily heating or cooling.

rechargeStatus.description: Recharge status of the water softener:  READY (providing soft water), RECHARGING (actively regenerating), RECHARGE_SCHEDULED (recharge required and will be done at rechargeStartTime)

currentSaltLevel.description: Current salt level from 0 (empty) to maxSaltLevel

saltLevelEnabled.description: true indicates currentSaltLevel should be accurate - false indicates currentSaltLevel should be ignored

rechargeStartTime.description: When regeneration is needed, hour of the day when it should be scheduled (e.g. 14 = 2:00 PM). Does not guarantee that regeneration will occur daily.

rechargeTimeRemaining.description: The number of minutes left before the softener completes its recharge cycle.

daysPoweredUp.description: The number of consecutive days the softener has been powered on

totalRecharges.description: The total number of recharge cycles the softener has performed since being added to the network

device.decription: The name of the watersoftener device.

primaryWaterHeater.description: When the first water heater is added it will be populated with that value.  This will be null if no water heater devices exist in the system.

primaryWaterSoftener.description: When the first water softener is added it will be populated with that value. This will be null if no water softener devices exist in the system.

closedWaterValves.description: The set of water shutoff valves that are currently closed.

waterDevices.description: The set of devices that participate in the water service.

continuousWaterUseDevices.description: The set of devices that have a continuous water use alert enabled and active.

excessiveWaterUseDevices.description: The set of devices that have an excessive water use alert enabled and active.

lowSaltDevices.description: The set of water softeners that have a low salt level.

mode.description: What mode this command is scheduled in:     ABSOLUTE - The time reported in time will be used.     SUNRISE - The command will execute at local sunrise + offsetMin.  The time reported in the time field will be the calculated run time for today.     SUNSET - The command will execute at local sunset + offsetMin. The time reported in the time field will be the calculated run time for today.

offsetMinutes.description: This will always be 0 if the mode is set to ABSOLUTE.  If mode is set to SUNRISE or SUNSET this will be the offset / delta from sunrise or sunset that the event should run at.  A negative number means the event should happen before sunrise/sunset, a postive means after.
